definitions.definition: To convert (a continuous space ) into an equivalent discrete space, often for the purposes of easier calculation.
To represent (any spectrum of reality) as a set of discrete categories or classes; to categorize (a spectral aspect of reality) by lumping together some of its finer distinctions.
examples: A rainbow truly contains thousands of color values but can usually be discretized by human sentience into bands of primary and secondary colors.

main_definition: ( transitive , mathematics , computing ) To convert (a continuous space ) into an equivalent discrete space, often for the purposes of easier calculation.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , loosely ) To represent (any spectrum of reality) as a set of discrete categories or classes; to categorize (a spectral aspect of reality) by lumping together some of its finer distinctions.
